The Buddha himself was known for his teachings on non-violence and compassion, but he also had no qualms about using force to achieve his goals. Furthermore, Buddhist dictators have a tendency to be particularly ruthless and oppressive, as they are often driven by a desire to suppress dissent and maintain control over their followers. This has led to numerous instances of genocide and other forms of violence throughout history, as Buddhist leaders have sought to impose their will on others through force and intimidation.
